column4: ive got ubuntu and windows on seperate fakeraid arrays. I can boot to ubuntu, but i cant boot to windows. Grub doesnt see it and i have no idea what the root is supposed to be with names like /dev/mapper/...
fakeraid is bad, m'kay? Don't use it.
there's not really another option for dualboot
There's /ALWAYS/ a better option than using fakeraid, 100% of the time.
What's your current raid setup looking like?
raid 0 is striping, which is not spanning.

Heck, with that, you have 2 HDD's. Use part of 1 to install Linux on, the other to install Windows on, and split the first as needed to share data between the two, if you don't do so with the second one anyway.
true, but id rather keep my speed
I've tested it and the tranfer rate was 50MB/s higher
